meanings.definition: A person who collects or gathers a large amount of something.
meanings.sent1: The amassers of stamps had a room full of colorful collections.
meanings.sent2: The amassers of knowledge in the library were always surrounded by books.
meanings.sent3: The amassers of seashells had so many, they could open a small museum.
meanings.sent4: She was an amassers of memories, storing each one carefully in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The amassers of coins had jars overflowing with shiny treasures.

meanings.definition: To gather or collect a large amount of something.
meanings.sent1: He would amassers all the fallen leaves in the yard into a big pile.
meanings.sent2: The chef would amassers all the ingredients before starting to cook.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to amassers as many rocks as they could find in the park.
meanings.sent4: She would amassers all the compliments she received like precious jewels.
meanings.sent5: The ants would amassers food for the winter, working tirelessly to store their provisions.
